result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bernadette Laureen Benjamin

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
11:28 AM Defendant Bernadette Laureen Benjamin in court.  Attorney Renee M Taber in court for Bernadette Laureen Benjamin.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for State of Wisconsin. Case is on for preliminary hearing.  State calls first witness, Officer C. Casady, who is sworn in and testifies.  Witness has identified the defendant.  Mr. Schmidt rests.  Atty Taber cross-examines witness. Ms. Taber rests.  No redirect.  No further witnesses.  Venue is made.  Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and the defendant probably committed it.  The matter is bound over for further proceedings.  The State files information.  Case on for Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.  Court advises of right to speedy trial and jury trial.  Defense requests STC.
Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on November 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.

on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
1:14 PM Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Bernadette Laureen Benjamin in court.  Court informs def she approved ct-appointed and explains the deposit and monthly payment process, wants to appoint atty Daniel Chapman (who is present in court).  Off the record 1:15 PM.  Back on the record 1:27 PM, Atty Chapman cannot represent in this case.  Court to adjourn, intends to appoint Christopher Gramstrup.  ADA Schmidt notes Gramstrup and Erdman will have conflicts.
Initial appearance scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Initial appearance on September 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.
on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney - $100 deposit
